#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Recognize a Fake Ralph Lauren
#Text=Ralph Lauren is a popular designer company that sells bags and clothing .
#Text=Unfortunately , given the brand 's popularity , counterfeit Ralph Lauren products are common .
#Text=If you 're worried you may have purchased a fake Ralph Lauren , examine small details like the stitching and logos .
#Text=If you do have a fake product , contact the Ralph Lauren company to report the issue .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Spotting Fake Clothing
#Text=Check the logo .
#Text=Ralph Lauren shirts often contain a small stitched on graphic of a polo player riding a horse .
#Text=On a fake Ralph Lauren , the mallet the rider holds will be more circular than rectangular .
#Text=The tail will be difficult to see and the horse 's right back leg will be bent .
#Text=On a genuine product , the horse 's tail is clearly visible and the right back leg is straight .
#Text=You should also be able to clearly see the outline of the rider 's leg .
#Text=On replicas , the leg often lacks definition .
#Text=As differences can be very subtle , it helps to look up an image of the actual logo for comparison .
#Text=You may also want to use something like a magnifying glass to get a very close look at the Ralph Lauren logo on your product .
#Text=Examine the stitching .
#Text=Turn your t-shirt inside out and examine the stitching on the bottom .
#Text=A genuine Ralph Lauren should have one thin line of even stitching running along the bottom of the shirt .
#Text=No stitching , or jagged and uneven stitching , indicates your product is fake .
#Text=Look at the collar label .
#Text=All Ralph Lauren products have labels under the collar indicating the size .
#Text=The main collar label contains the Ralph Lauren logo and , to the right , a small tag is sticking out with the size written on it .
#Text=If there is not a separate size label , the product is likely fake .
#Text=The font should also be easily legible without misspellings .
#Text=In addition to this , stitching along the collar should be the same color as the shirt .
#Text=High quality replicas can be extremely similar to authentic size labels , so look at a picture of a genuine size label online to compare it to your shirt 's label .
#Text=Even small changes in the font , including changes in spacing , can indicate a fake .
#Text=Examine the buttons .
#Text=Buttons are secured with a neat pearl and cross stitch with thread that matches the color of the shirt .
#Text=A different type of stitch , mismatched thread , or loose threads indicate a fake .
#Text=Check the hem .
#Text=Lay your shirt down a flat surface .
#Text=The back hemline should be slightly longer than the front hemline .
#Text=Hemlines of equal length , or a front hemline that 's longer than the back , indicate a fake product .
#Text=Read the care label .
#Text=There should be a care label somewhere near the bottom of the shirt , which contains a trademark R and neat , evenly spaced copy .
#Text=Illegible copy , or the absence of an " R , " usually mean the product is fake .
#Text=As with other aspects of fake products , differences can be very subtle .
#Text=It can help to look up a picture of a genuine Ralph Lauren label online to compare and contrast .
#Text=Identifying Fake Bags
#Text=Check for sloppy stitching .
#Text=Ralph Lauren is an expensive , high-end product .
#Text=Stitching anywhere on the bag should be extremely neat and the same types of stitches should be used throughout the bag , including inside the pockets and on the underside of the bag .
#Text=Inconsistent stitching and loose threads are signs of a fake product .
#Text=Examine the material closely .
#Text=Fake purses will have a stiff feel , indicating they 're made from cheaper materials than authentic products .
#Text=Color may be inconsistent throughout the bag , appearing darker or lighter in certain areas .
#Text=Also , designer purses do not have lining while fake purses do .
#Text=Check for inaccuracies in the label .
#Text=The label should be stitched in .
#Text=Hang tags are an obvious sign of a fake product .
#Text=Fake labels often have misspellings , illegible font , and have sloppy stitching with loose threads .
#Text=In higher quality counterfeit products , differences may be extremely subtle .
#Text=Look up a photo of a genuine Ralph Lauren label online and compare and contrast this to your bag 's label .
#Text=Examine all the small details closely .
#Text=Sometimes , small details are the only way to spot a fake product .
#Text=The handles of your bag should be the same length , the logo should not be crooked , and zippers and buttons should be firmly attached and work properly .
#Text=Designer products tend to be very high quality .
#Text=It is unlikely that a designer bag would have any obvious flaws and imperfections .
#Text=Reporting a Fake Item
#Text=Contact the company directly .
#Text=Ralph Lauren is invested in cracking down on counterfeits .

#Text=If you have a counterfeit product , report the issue by contacting Ralph Lauren by phone at 888-475-7674 or e-mailing them at RLcounterfeits@ralphlauren.com. Let them know you think you accidentally purchased a fake product and include the details of where you bought the product .
#Text=Report any local counterfeiters to the police .
#Text=If you bought a product from a local supplier , report the issue to the local authorities .
#Text=If a business in your area is selling counterfeit products , the local police may want to investigate the matter themselves .
#Text=The police may also be able to get you a refund for a counterfeit product .
#Text=Stick to purchasing merchandise directly from Ralph Lauren .
#Text=If you purchase products directly from Ralph Lauren stores or their website , this is a surefire way to get a genuine product .
#Text=You can also purchase products at popular department stores that have a known relationship with the Ralph Lauren brand .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Adhere to the adage , " If it sounds too good to be true , it probably is " when purchasing Ralph Lauren products .
#Text=Ralph Lauren products will be more expensive than average , so if someone offers you a very cheap Ralph Lauren item , it 's probably counterfeit .
#Text=Quick Summary
